item.title: 今年的飓风季显示航空公司对气候的担忧正在显现
item.description:
暴风雨只是众多因气候变化而引发的危害之一，这些危害让航空公司对其底线忧心忡忡。【原文：

Storms are just one of the many climate change-fueled hazards that have airlines worried about their bottom line.

】

item.title: 如何将投资者纳入国家气候战略
item.description:
机构投资者敦促正在制定 2035 年减排计划的国家阐明融资机会。【原文：

Countries working on their plans for emissions reductions through 2035 are being urged by institutional investors to spell out financing opportunities.

】

item.title: 西班牙士兵搜寻失踪人员，死亡人数上升
item.description: 西班牙救援队正在洪水肆虐的派波尔塔市搜寻数十名失踪人员，本周暴风雨造成的死亡人数已上升到至少 158 人。【原文：Spanish rescue teams are searching for dozens of missing people in the flood-ravaged city of Paiporta, as the death toll from this week’s storms rose to at least 158.】

item.title: 英国石油公司大托尔图天然气项目是毛里塔尼亚的 "重要组成部分" 能源
item.description: 毛里塔尼亚将优先使用英国石油公司（BP Plc）大托尔图-阿赫迈耶姆（Greater Tortue Ahmeyim）开发项目的天然气，因为毛里塔尼亚希望在增加可再生能源的同时提高电力供应。【原文：Mauritania will prioritize using gas from BP Plc’s Greater Tortue Ahmeyim development as it looks to increase access to electricity while it adds more renewable energy.】

item.title: 核能复兴对铀价格的影响
item.description:
它会成为美国变革的主要受益者吗？【原文：

Could it be a major beneficiary of changes in the US?

】

item.title: 奇货可居：核能复兴对铀意味着什么（播客）
item.description: 有一种对铀的崇拜：投资者和交易商相信核能是能源的未来，因此这种重要的商品最终会成为大赢家。在过去几年里，铀的价格大幅上涨。但铀市场的经济效益如何？它对一些正在重开的发电厂有多敏感？在本期节目中，我们将与伯恩斯坦公司美洲能源与转型部门主管、大宗商品专家鲍勃-布拉克特（Bob Brackett）进行对话。【原文：There’s something of a uranium cult out there: the investors and traders who believe that nuclear is the future of energy, and therefore this crucial commodity will end up being a huge winner. And over the last several years, the price has gone up substantially. But what are the economics of the uranium market? And how sensitive is it to some of these power plants that are reopening? On this episode, we speak with commodities guru Bob Brackett, head of Americas energy and transition at Bernstein】

item.title: 西班牙洪灾过后，欧洲将迎来温和干燥的十一月
item.description: 月初气温短暂下降后，欧洲将迎来一个温和干燥的十一月。【原文：After a brief drop in temperatures at the beginning of the month, Europe is in for a mild and dry November.】

item.title: 西班牙致命洪灾显示适应强降雨的难度
item.description:
气候变化为极端暴雨的 "完美温床 "创造了条件。【原文：

Climate change helped create conditions that are the “perfect breeding ground” for extreme downpours.

】

item.title: 对工党预算案的两声 "绿色欢呼 "和一声 "巨大嘘声
item.description:
在该党的计划中，有几项有利于气候的措施很有希望，但它们都被燃料责任的懦弱所掩盖。【原文：

There are a couple of promising things for climate in the party's plans, but they're overshadowed by fuel-duty cowardice.

】

item.title: 可再生能源激增，欧盟排放量下降
item.description:
新的风能和太阳能以及化石燃料的减少推动了排放量的下降。【原文：

New wind and solar and a decline in fossil fuels have driven a drop in emissions.

】

item.title: 西班牙部署 1,700 名士兵协助致命风暴救灾工作
item.description: 西班牙正在部署 1700 名士兵协助救援工作，以营救因灾难性风暴而受困的灾民，风暴已在西班牙东部造成 150 多人死亡，而该国其他地区的降雨仍在继续蔓延。【原文：Spain is deploying 1,700 soldiers to assist in relief efforts to rescue victims trapped by the disastrous storms that have killed more than 150 people in eastern Spain, as rain continues to spread in other parts of the country.】

item.title: 银行家等待碳交易之际，美国银行呼吁消除流动性障碍
item.description: 据美国银行（Bank of America Corp）称，在碳信用额市场上，一项改变游戏规则的全球交易看起来比以往任何时候都更接近达成。【原文：In the market for carbon credits, a game-changing global deal looks closer than ever, according to Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺在气候问题上调转方向引发绕过他的行动
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注政府官员、环保人士和其他人士在唐纳德-特朗普重夺白宫后为围绕他开展气候外交所做的幕后努力。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读本篇报道的完整版。如需了解我们的更多报道，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at behind-the-scenes efforts by government officials, environmentalists and others to navigate climate diplomacy around Donald Trump if he wins back the White House. You can read the full version of this story on Bloomberg.com. For more of our coverage, please subscribe.】

item.title: 如果特朗普获胜，气候外交官准备绕过美国的角色
item.description:
秘密会谈正准备在一个敌对的美国总统领导下保持全球合作。如果美国再次退出《巴黎协定》，那么领导权就可能移交给中国。【原文：

Secret talks are preparing to keep global cooperation alive under an adversarial US president. A second American withdrawal from the Paris accord could turn leadership over to China.

】

item.title: 围绕 "气候避风港 "的模糊信息
item.description:
为什么像阿什维尔这样易受洪水侵袭的内陆城市会被吹捧为不受极端天气影响的地方？州政府和联邦政府发出的信号不一，部分原因在于此。【原文：

Why were flood-prone inland cities like Asheville touted as places safe from extreme weather? Mixed signals from state and federal authorities bear some of the blame. 

】

item.title: 电动汽车需求减弱，福特将停止 F-150 闪电的生产
item.description: 由于电动汽车的需求持续减弱，福特汽车公司计划在今年年底前关闭生产其标志性电动汽车 F-150 Lightning 插电式皮卡的密歇根工厂。【原文：Ford Motor Co. plans to shut down the Michigan factory that produces its F-150 Lightning plug-in pickup truck, its signature electric vehicle, through the end of the year as demand for EVs continues to wane.】

item.title: 研究发现：改变生活方式是减少排放的直接途径
item.description:
新的研究结果表明，少吃肉和减少食物浪费有助于全球向排放目标迈进。【原文：

New findings show that eating less meat and cutting food waste help get the world move closer to its emissions goals.

】

item.title: 大型石油公司认为巴西将成为全球主要的清洁航空燃料中心
item.description: 全球都在推动航空旅行去碳化，从大型石油公司到主权财富基金，都把赌注押在巴西，希望它能成为全球顶级的绿色航空燃料中心。【原文：A global push to decarbonize air travel has groups from Big Oil to sovereign wealth funds betting on Brazil to become a top global center for green jet fuel.】

item.title: 美国投票之际，这些大型能源项目岌岌可危
item.description:
哈里斯和特朗普在竞选总统时都曾高调承诺降低能源账单，但他们对如何降低能源账单的愿景却截然不同。【原文：

Harris and Trump have both touted the promise of lower energy bills while campaigning for president — but they’ve laid out starkly different visions for how to get them.

】

item.title: 火灾和洪水使气候成为巴西人的主要担忧
item.description: 在路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统准备明年主办一次重要的全球气候大会之际，破纪录的洪水、干旱和火灾使巴西人比以往任何时候都更加担心环境问题，并将其转化为一个强有力的政治问题。【原文：Record-breaking floods, droughts and fires have Brazilians more worried about the environment than ever, turning it into a potent political issue as President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva prepares to host a major global climate conference next year.】

item.title: 降雨持续不断，西班牙面临致命风暴的抉择
item.description: 西班牙东部的灾难性暴风雨已造成 90 多人死亡，救援工作已进入第三天，而该国其他地区的降雨仍在继续蔓延。【原文：Relief efforts to rescue victims trapped by the disastrous storms that have killed more than 90 people in eastern Spain are entering their third day, as rain continues to spread in other parts of the country.】

item.title: 印度德里为何是世界上空气污染最严重的城市之一？
item.description: 数亿印度人常年呼吸着世界上最有毒的空气。拥有约 3000 万人口的首都地区的空气污染尤为严重。在冬季，寒冷的天气实际上使烟雾更加严重和强烈。新德里的一项污染指标经常超过世界卫生组织建议的每日限值 20 倍以上。研究表明，印度的污浊空气每年导致约 100 万人或更多人死亡，这是一个巨大的数字。【原文：Hundreds of millions of Indians breathe some of the world’s most toxic air year round. Air pollution in the capital area that’s home to about 30 million people is especially stubborn. In winter, the cold weather actually makes the smog even worse — and potent. One measure of pollution in New Delhi frequently exceeds the World Health Organization’s daily recommended limits by a factor of more than 20. Studies show India’s dirty air has been killing about a million or more people a year, a massive】

item.title: 德里在排灯节庆祝活动前被烟雾吞没
item.description: 就在数百万人准备庆祝印度教排灯节之际，世界上雾霾最严重的首都创下了今年以来最严重的空气污染记录。【原文：The world’s smoggiest capital has recorded its worst air pollution since the start of the year, just as millions prepare to celebrate the Hindu festival of Diwali.】

item.title: 黑客攻击地球需要防护栏和准则
item.description:
现在，太阳能地球工程已不仅仅是科幻小说，它需要一个监管系统。【原文：

Now that solar geoengineering isn't just sci-fi, a regulatory system is required.

】

item.title: 南非寻求数十亿气候基金以维持煤电厂开工
item.description: 南非承诺减少其燃煤发电厂的排放量，以争取获得 26 亿美元的气候融资。尽管南非试图改变 2022 年协议的条款，推迟彻底关闭其中三座设施。【原文：South Africa pledged to slash emissions across its fleet of coal-fired power plants in a bid to secure $2.6 billion in climate finance. That’s despite seeking to alter the terms of a 2022 agreement by delaying the outright closure of three of the facilities.】

item.title: 世界上最脏的燃料之一正在涨价
item.description: 全球石油市场中最肮脏的一角正在上演一场精彩的反弹，原因是为避开中东动乱而航行更长航程的船只需求激增。【原文：One of the dirtiest corners of the global oil market is staging a spectacular rally, boosted by surging demand from ships sailing longer voyages to avoid unrest in the Middle East.】

item.title: 台湾在关闭交易所后为超强台风 "天鸽 "做好准备
item.description: 超强台风 "天鸽 "是今年晚些时候袭击台湾的最大风暴之一，台湾居民正严阵以待，以应对它的直接袭击，因此台湾暂停了 2.5 万亿美元股票市场的交易。【原文：Taiwan has suspended trading on its $2.5 trillion stock market as residents brace for a direct hit from Super Typhoon Kong-Rey, one of the biggest storms to strike the island this late in the year.】

item.title: 亚洲投资级美元债券利差收窄至历史新低
item.description: 在中国政策制定者采取了一系列货币和财政刺激措施，提升了亚洲债务的吸引力之后，亚洲评级最高的债券发行商的美元债券利差收窄至历史最低点。【原文：Dollar bond spreads for Asia’s top-rated issuers have narrowed to a record low after a blitz of monetary and fiscal stimulus measures by Chinese policymakers boosted the appeal of the region’s debt.】

item.title: 亚洲急于建造更环保的办公室，香港却落在后面
item.description:
法规的缺乏和房地产的不景气正在推迟该地区顶级金融中心之一的建筑的绿色升级。【原文：

Lack of regulations and a property slump are delaying green upgrades to buildings in one of the region’s top financial hubs.

】

item.title: 加州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）抨击高电费
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）命令州政府机构想方设法降低已成为全美最高电价的电费，只要任何削减电费的建议不会威胁到应对气候变化的斗争。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom ordered state agencies to look for ways to lower electricity rates that have become some of the nation’s highest, so long as any proposed cuts don’t threaten the fight against climate change.】
